p: Eighty‐nine dogs met the inclusion criteria. Lesions interpreted as PC were observed in 12 dogs (13,5%). Brain areas affected included piriform lobes and/or hippocampus, cingulate gyrus, and more diffuse cortico‐subcortical areas. PC were bilateral in 6 dogs. Three dogs suffered SE, 6 dogs had clusters and 3 dogs isolated seizures. Mean time between last seizure and MRI was lower in dogs with PC. Prevalence of idiopathic and structural epilepsy was similar in both affected and unaffected dogs.
